name: Baby Back Ribs
headline: Baby Back Ribs

keywords: Barbecue Restaurants,Ribs Recipes,Meat,Pork,Main Dish,Gluten Free,High Fiber
recipeIngredient: One 2.25-pound slab of baby back pork ribs (also known as loin-back ribs)
2 tablespoons BBQ sauce, for glazing, optional

recipeInstructions.text: For the rub: The day before cooking, mix the turbinado sugar, salt, paprika, chili powder, granulated garlic, onion powder, ground cumin, ground mustard, cayenne pepper and black pepper together.
For the ribs: Take a slab of ribs and turn over so the curved side is up. Using your fingernail or a knife, pry under the membrane until you can put your finger under it and then pull it off.

Sprinkle this side of the ribs with about 1 tablespoon rub, and then about 1 tablespoon yellow mustard. Use the mustard to help evenly distribute the seasoning. Turn the ribs over and repeat the process. Cover and store in the refrigerator overnight.

To cook, start a smoker and bring the temp to 200 degrees F. Use apple or cherry wood chunks to provide smoke and flavor. Place the ribs in the smoker, curved side down. Smoke for 2 hours at 200 degrees F, and then raise the temperature to 250 degrees F for about 2 1/2 hours. Check for tenderness by testing if the bones will pull apart with a slight bit of pressure. If they are still tough, allow to cook for another 30 minutes.
Remove from the smoker. For dry-style ribs, sprinkle with about 1 tablespoon rub. For wet-style ribs, glaze with the BBQ sauce.

review.reviewBody: Great ribs. Had no turbinado, so sub’d dark brown sugar.  Rubbed and refrigerated overnight. Cooked in bed of onions with 1/4 stock for 6 hours, painted Sweet Baby Ray’s hickory sauce and finished uncovered in 400 degree oven for 20 minutes. Very satisfied with flavor of ribs!
I really enjoyed the flavor!
This rub was great, my family loved it
Delicious! Testing recipes for a rib cook off and this is one in using. Super easy and flavorful will do these again!
Wonderful. Great flavor and so tender

This recipe was delicious! I didn't want to miss out on this recipe or obsess over what I didn't have, so I did what I could! Didn't have a smoker but used the oven and all was well!
Deviations:
Yellow Mustard - forgot it!
Turbinado- Subbed brown sugar
4 Tbsp chili powder- Subbed 3Tbsp chilli-o and 1 Tbsp coacoa powder
Coarse salt - Subbed Pink Himalayan
Spanish paprika- Subbed smoked paprika
I would not change the recipe at all.. I can't wait to try with all the intended ingredients! I'm not a griller. My 13yo son and I managed to pull this off for my husband's Father's Day meal and it was still fall off the bone. We were all very impressed.

Lip smacking, fall off the bone, fantastic ribs.  I didn’t have time to let these ribs set overnight so they got 30 minutes with the rub.  Additionally we had really bad weather so I had to use the oven.  I just covered the ribs with foil and baked them for 2 hours on 200, then upped the heat to 250 and baked them for another 2.5 hours.  I removed the foil, brushed them with Sweet Baby Rays BBQ Sauce, turned the oven to broil and broiled them for 8 minutes, which gave them a succulent coating of sauce.  My new favorite rib recipe!
my familyI can't wait to make this and Share it with .

The best! Thank you for sharing! People are complaining about the amount of rub, why not make a lot and save it? It will keep for quite a while in a closed container. The next time you barbecue, rub done.
Long awaited world class rub with smoking instructions....

My first time making ribs and it came out delicious!  I made it for a super bowl party i followed the recipe exactly i didn't change one thing. It was tender and just the right ingredients i used a slow cooker for 4 hours on high and then transferred the ribs adding  BBQ sauce on them before i  put it  into  the oven to broil for 8 minutes and it was good to go! can't wait to make it again :)
Love the recipe...but as someone else asked...why make so much?

OMG!!!! These baby back ribs are FANTASTIC!!!!! My family loves these ribs, they couldn't believe that I cooked them myself. The only thing missing that would have topped off this meal was to have Guy Fieri here himself. Thank you for sharing this recipe with us Guy, you are the BEST!!! We love you on Triple D's and Guy's Grocery Game...You ROCK!!!
Best recipe I've found yet.  Thank you for sharing.

I am sure this will taste amazing - the flavors in the rub are full of promise! I've got my ribs marinating overnight.  One question - what do I do with the rest of the rub?  And why make so much for just one slab? I didn't figure this out before I started, so now I have enough rub to cook several Costco -sized-packages of ribs.  Hello folks, it's pork night for the next month!

Absolutely amazing! Baby backs are so poorly made by the chain restaurants around here. Even Tony Roma's couldn't get it right and failed quickly because of their poor quality. I also have attempted baby backs and failed many times. But not this recipe. I have used it twice and the ribs were perfect! You have to try this recipe! No short cuts!

Saw this show when it aired, and this chef's calm manner about bbq, got to me big time....yes I can now see the printed recipe, but moreso my brain honed in on Melissa's directions as spoken on the show.....I did 220° for 2 hours and then upped the temp to 230° for 3 additional hours. I confess I used a different rub...one that I already had. But may I also confess that these were the best babybacks that have ever passed my lips? I'm calling this recipe "Ribs from the T.V." and they will be made again, and again, and......again.
P.S.
One of the BEST parts of this recipe....no cooking naked ribs and then foiling them, and then finishing them unfoiled. This was SO easy.

Have made this rub twice--and once actually let them sit overnite the other time rubbed and smoked shortly thereafter.  Both times it was excellent, smokey, tender and very flavorful.  Will continue to use as my go to rub.  and didn't miss the cumin but will add to my next batch just to check it out.  And tasty on brisket too.
Being from Mississippi....I have tried every recipe known to man....This is the best...If I don't make them...I"m drivin there to eat them.....Best in Memphis!!!

Update: We have added the missing 2 teaspoons ground cumin to the recipe.

Admin Customer Service

These ribs are amazing. I always try to follow a recipe exactly the first time I make it. I found I used way more rub and mustard than called for. Think I would use a spicy ground mustard next time. These will be a huge hit at your next BBQ!

This dry rub was outstanding!! I used it on thick pork chops on the grill that I left in cooler overnight with this dry rub on it and the bar b que was sweet and we did not use a wet sauce because it did not need it.  One thing that I saw on TV was they forgot to mention on the website recipe for the dry rub was the addition of cumin that was shown on TV.

video.name: Memphis Ribs in Mississippi
video.description: Guy visits a bbq joint in Mississippi for the secret behind Memphis ribs.
